name: Document Title: ITP-325-CIV Landscaping - Ground Preparation
ITP approved for use by: Romualdo Magpantay
Referenced Documentation: VicRoads 720 AS 4454, AS 4419 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— Using the correct and complete set of IFC drawings
— All drawings are the latest revision
Frequency - Prior to Commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - Samples, records and certificates shall be provided to the Nominated Authority (NA) at least 10 working days prior to bulk delivery.
Following information shall be provided to the NA:
Frequency - Prior to Commencement of works
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Issue to TeamBinder: Records & certificates
Acceptance Criteria - Site won topsoil to be tested to establish what soil amendments and macro and micro nutreints are required to be added to the top soil if required by planting subcontractor.
○ Where imported topsoil is used, the topsoil must conform to the properties specified in Table 720.042 and align with IFC Drawings .
Method - Verify, Doc. Review if applicable
Frequency - Prior to Commencement of works
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Issue to TeamBinder: material conformance docs or Test Report
Reference - Section 720.04, Table 720.044, AS4454 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Site mulch available from the chipping of on-site indigenous or non-weed vegetation shall be used where possible, otherwise approved mulch stated on IFC drawings.
○ All wood mulch to be spread in accordance to AS 4454 and conform to required depth stated in IFC drawings .
○ Imported Wood Mulch shall comply with Table 720.044.
Method - Verify, Doc. Review if applicable
Frequency - Prior to Commencement of works
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Issue to TeamBinder: material conformance docs (if applicable)
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall set out the location and shape of planting areas in accordance with the Landscape Drawings.

Acceptance Criteria - Soil additives, including any material used to modify the chemical properties of the soil, shall be applied by the Contractor prior to physical ripping and cultivation and in accordance with results and recommendations from site topsoil analysis tests, if applicable.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Attach Test Report
Acceptance Criteria - All ripping works shall conform to the requirements of 720.07
— Planting Areas in disturbed areas flatter than 3h:1v= min 400mm deep at a max of 500mm spacing
— Planting Areas in disturbed areas steeper than 3h:1v= min 300mm at a max 500mm spacing
— Planting Areas in undisturbed areas = Min 400mm deep at a max of 500mm spacing
— Grassing in disturbed areas = Min 200 mm deep, 500 mm max spacing
— Individual Tree Planting within grassed areas = min 400mm deep at a max of 500mm spacing
○ Note: Ripping shall not occur within the extent of existing vegetation areas marked for protection or within the drip-line of existing woody plants.
○ Do not proceed until the NA inspects and acknowledges requirements for ripping have been met.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall set out the location and shape of edging in accordance with the IFC Drawings.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Attach Delivery Dockets if applicable
Acceptance Criteria - Topsoil shall be spread on planting areas and grassed areas in accordance with minimum top soil depths stated in the IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Cultivation will only take place if easy manual excavation cannot be achieved to 300mm or deeper.
○ If easy manual excavation is not achieved the following will take place
— Planting Areas in disturbed areas flatter than 3h:1v = 150mm Minimum
— Planting Areas in undisturbed areas=150mm Minimum

○ Note: Cultivation shall not occur within the extent of existing vegetation areas marked for protection or the drip-line of existing woody plants. Hand cultivation shall be used within root zones of trees to be retained.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected
Acceptance Criteria - After cultivation and trimming, the Contractor may lightly compress topsoil for stability on slopes.
— Vibrating plates shall not be used.
○ The finished level of garden bed mulch and/or topsoil shall be tapered so that the finished mulch and/or topsoil levels meet flush with the adjacent surfaces.
○ The finished level of grassed areas shall be:
— not higher than 125 mm below weep-holes or damp-proof courses in adjacent walls;
— level with the bottom of fence plinths;
— level with adjacent pavements, kerbs, pits and other structures.
○ Do not proceed until the NA inspects & acknowledges requirements for topsoiling and cultivation have been met
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected
3.8 - Weed and Erosion Control Mat (if applicable)
Acceptance Criteria - Jute or approved equivalent to be installed as indicated by the IFC drawing.

○ Jute mat to be installed where specified on IFC drawings for planting areas steeper than 2:1 and in planting areas prone to flooding or within 2m of waterways, swales, wetlands and sedimentation ponds.
○ Mat shall be laid and anchored in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Reference TeamBinder Material Approval No. if applicable, Attach Delivery Dockets
Acceptance Criteria - Wood mulch to be placed at all planting areas unless specified.
○ Mulch shall extend at least 1 metre beyond plant centres at the outer edges of all planting areas.
○ If space does not permit this, mulching shall extend to the back of kerb.
○ Ecodynamics shall install mulch rings around individual tree plantings.
○ Mulch depths in all situations shall be a minimum 75mm and maximum 125mm.
○ Mulch shall be raked to an even, neat appearance and kept clear of plant stems to avoid collar rot.

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
ITP approved for use by: Romualdo Magpantay
Referenced Documentation: IFC Drawings Vic Roads Section 720 (Jul '24)
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using:
— The correct and complete set of drawings
— All drawings are the latest revision
Acceptance Criteria - Inspections, Samples, records and certificates shall be provided to the Superintendent at least 10 working days prior to bulk delivery.
○ Following information shall be provided to the superintendent:
— Inspections of plant stock for all plant species
— Evidence of origin of indigenous provenance plant material
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Attach Records to TeamBinder Approval Form
Acceptance Criteria - All plants shall be of the type, height, container size and trunk caliper specified in the Plant Schedules, Specification and Planting Plans.
— Plants are to conform to the supply properties specified in Table 720.041
Acceptance Criteria - A species listed on the planting schedule shall be classed as an indigenous plant if the plant is likely to have occurred within 10 km of the project site (pre 1750).
○ The Contractor shall submit documentation of origin of indigenous provenance plant material which shall include the following details for each seed lot:
— approximate number of parent plants sampled
— approximate number of plants in that local population
Acceptance Criteria - Grass seed shall comply with Table 720.045
Acceptance Criteria - Subcontractor ITP to be reviewed and approved by MRPA.
Reference - VicRoads Spec. Cl.720.06, Landscape Plus Planting ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Trial planting sections have been approved by the Superintendent. These approved sections shall be used as a reference for the remaining planting works
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall develop and implement site specific pest and weed management procedures to control pest and weed populations.
○ Pre-planting weed control shall be undertaken to ensure that planting areas and new grassed areas are free of visible weeds prior to the commencement of planting and grassing.
Acceptance Criteria - Planting areas are to be set out to the location and shape specified in the landscape drawings.
○ Plant density requiremens and planting offsets established in the plant schedule are to be adhered to.

○ Individual plants shall be located in accordance with the drawings such that the mature form of the plant will be in accordance with VicRoads Road Design Guidelines, including clear zone and sight distance requirements.
Reference - VicRoads Spec. Cl.720.09, Landscape Plus Planting ITP
Acceptance Criteria - All planting will be undertaken in accordance to the contractors Planting ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Contractors ITP signed and completed
Frequency - Following completion of planting works
Verifying Documents - Sub-Contractor ITP completed, signed and to be attached

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
